document_data.name: Spindle Street
document_data.mainbody: '''Spindle Street''' was a lesser avenue, paved in corduroy-logs, in the [[Waterdeep/Trades Ward|Trades Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]].
document_data.Geography: This street ran from north to south, running off of [[Selduth Street]] and trailing down south until it terminated on [[Coffinmarch]].
document_data.History:
In the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], over the course of a [[tenday]] and more, streets across the Trades Ward experienced a number of [[ghost]]ly sightings. In and around Coffinmarch and Spindle Street in particular, Waterdhavians reported a floating head peering in at windows by day and pursuing during the night.{{Cite web/Waterdeep News/Ghost Sightings}}

These sightings left many citizens, scribes, and members of the [[City Watch (Waterdeep)|City Watch]] confused and some speculated if a [[wizard]] experimenting with [[illusion]]s may have been the cause.

Notable Locations.Links to Sewers: An entrance to the [[Waterdeep/Sewers|sewers of Waterdeep]] was located on this street, right before it terminated on to Selduth Street.

document_data.Notable Inhabitants:
* The [[Buckleswashers]], a [[halfling]] [[adventurer]] company.<ref>
* Duroamyn Steelhawk, a famous [[adventurer]], and later his two daughters Ierithue and Sharlma.

* Myrmith Splendon.
